DataElement.preferredName: Malignant Ovarian Neoplasm Clinical Remission Ind-2
DataElement.preferredDefinition: the yes/no indicator related to having all clinical signs and symptoms of cancer disappearing for a primary or metastatic malignant tumor involving the ovary.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information related to having all clinical signs and symptoms of cancer disappearing for a primary or metastatic malignant tumor involving the ovary.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A primary or metastatic malignant tumor involving the ovary.  Most primary malignant ovarian neoplasms are either carcinomas (serous, mucinous, or endometrioid adenocarcinomas) or malignant germ cell tumors.  Metastatic malignant neoplasms to the ovary include carcinomas, lymphomas, and melanomas. -- 2004

Concepts.definition: A primary or metastatic malignant neoplasm involving the ovary. Most primary malignant ovarian neoplasms are either carcinomas (serous, mucinous, or endometrioid adenocarcinomas) or malignant germ cell tumors. Metastatic malignant neoplasms to the ovary include carcinomas, lymphomas, and melanomas.

Property.preferredDefinition: Having to do with the examination and treatment of patients.:An abatement in intensity or degree (as in the manifestations of a disease).

Concepts.definition: Relating to the examination and treatment of patients dependent on direct observation.  The term may also refer to the institution (clinic) providing this activity.
An abatement in intensity or degree (as in the manifestations of a disease).

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

DataElementConcept.origin: GOG CRF:Gynecologic Oncology Group Case Report Form

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Conceptual domain that includes value meanings to be used for Indicator Value Meanings such as Yes, No, Unknown, No Applicable

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A caDSR representation term that is used to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no

Concepts.definition: A response or indicator that can have a value of either yes or no.

ReferenceDocuments.name: Is the patient now in clinica
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is the patient now in clinical remission, including having normal CA-125 values, a negative physical exam, and no evidence of definitive disease by CT of the abdomen and pelvis
